citation.article-title: Labrys okinawensis sp. nov. and Labrys miyagiensis sp. nov., budding bacteria isolated from rhizosphere habitats in Japan, and emended descriptions of the genus Labrys and Labrys monachus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Labrys

Characteristics of the genus are as described by Vasil'eva & Semenov (1984), except that cells can be rod-shaped and may or may not possess triangular radial symmetry, may have short prosthecae, can be motile or non-motile and may be facultative methylotrophs; furthermore, the G+C content of the DNA varies from 61.0 to 66.0 mol% and the predominant cellular fatty acids are C19 : 0 cycloω8c, C16 : 0, C18 : 0 and C18 : 1ω7c.
The genus belongs to the Alphaproteobacteria.
